column2: DIARY-U.S. MEETINGS/WEEK AHEADNon-profit sues U.S. SEC to force political disclosures rules WASHINGTON
column3: May 13 A newly created non-profit organization sued the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday in an effort to force the agency to adopt rules requiring companies to disclose political contributions.  Non-profit sues U.S. SEC to force political disclosures rules WASHINGTON

column2: Wal-Mart challenges Amazon with unlimited shipping service for $50 per year CHICAGO
column3: May 13 Wal-Mart Stores Inc is planning to test a new unlimited online shipping service this summer for $50 per year
column4: a move that may hurt Amazon's annual $99 Prime shipping service.

column2: U.S. Air Force to reevaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedUPDATE 1-U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedU.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp.  U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp. WASHINGTON

column5: May 13 The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would immediately reevaluate bids received in a long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a lawsuit filed by Raytheon Co that was aimed at staving off protests filed by losing bidders Northrop Grumman Corp  and Lockheed Martin Corp.UPDATE 1-U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedU.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp. column2: FINRA fines Morgan Stanley $2 mln for short-selling violationsUPDATE 1-FINRA fines Morgan Stanley $2 mln for short-selling violationsFINRA fines Morgan Stanley $2 million for short-selling violations Wall Street's industry-funded watchdog said it had fined Morgan Stanley $2 million for violations of short-interest reporting and short-sale rules for more than six years. U.S. Air Force to reevaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedUPDATE 1-U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedU.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp.  U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp. WASHINGTON

column2: Business groups say ADA doesn't entitle blind Pfizer worker to driver Three major business groups have asked a U.S. appeals court to uphold the dismissal of a former Pfizer Inc sales representative's suit claiming the pharmaceutical giant violated federal law by refusing to provide her with a full-time driver when she became legally blind.

column2: U.S. Air Force to reevaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedUPDATE 1-U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedU.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp.  U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp. WASHINGTON

column5: May 13 The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would immediately reevaluate bids received in a long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a lawsuit filed by Raytheon Co that was aimed at staving off protests filed by losing bidders Northrop Grumman Corp  and Lockheed Martin Corp.UPDATE 1-U.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit deniedU.S. Air Force to re-evaluate radar bids after Raytheon suit denied WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday said it would re-evaluate bids received in a $1 billion long-range radar competition after a federal court dismissed a Raytheon Co lawsuit that sought to halt a fresh look at the bidders of its losing rivals Northrop Grumman Corp and Lockheed Martin Corp.
